decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed installation of the access ramp and the creation of the second vehicle access together with the proposed hard landscape works and the proposed replacement boundary wall, pillars and gates, by reason of the loss existing soft landscaping, excessive hard landscape works, overall appearance of the front boundary treatment and the inappropriate removal of two street trees would lead the loss of forecourt and streetside greenery that the site and its surrounding currently provides and would lead to an overall hard and formal form of front boundary treatment that fails to respect the visual setting for the host dwelling and the wider character of the area, contrary to the high-quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Policy D3 (D(1) and D(11)) of The London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1 (B) of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012) and Policies DM1, DM22 and DM23 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).
description: Outbuilding with patio at rear for use as 'Granny Annexe'; access ramp to side of main dwelling; installation of 1.4m to 1.94m high brick built front boundary wall with 1.94m high metal vehicle access and pedestrain gates; external steps to front; hardsurfacing of front garden; alterations to landscaping at front and rear; external alterations (demolition of outbuilding and front boundary wall)
